The dirtiest cop — the one who lets the most number of killers escape, wins the game by becoming the Squad’s undisputed leader and the Mafia’s highest-paid Inside Man. A reputed spot that can only be won by playing dirty!

Test your skills in this underhanded bluffing card game and find out if you've got what it takes to out-bluff and outsmart the others and become the undisputed leader of your Squad!

What's in the box:
There are 122 cards — a mix of Character Cards and Power Cards:
25 Killers, 12 Accomplices, 12 Family Members, 12 Witnesses, 12 Victim’s Friends, 12 Innocent Bystanders, 2 Character Impersonators + 35 Power Cards + 70 medal tokens. 

The aim of the game: 
To release the most number of killers from your hand. 

How to Play: 
You start by shuffling the deck of cards thoroughly and dealing 7 cards to each player, along with 3 medal tokens. 

You have to bluff the killers out of your hand, so when you want to let go of killers, they must be disguised as any of the other characters. You must never announce the fact that you are releasing a killer. 

Hand Example: you have 2 killers, 2 family members, 1 innocent bystander and 2 power cards in your hand, and in your first turn you want to release killers:
Place one or both of the Killer Cards face down and announce ANY OTHER character. (Say: 2 Family Members)
Only you know that the two cards are NOT Family Members but the others have to gauge whether you are bluffing or telling the truth
The player to your immediate left gets to decide whether he would like to open the cards and check them, or trust you and let them pass. If he passes it goes to the next player and the decision falls upon him. If no one checks your cards they go face down in your Released Pile. No one knows what cards have gone except you

If a player decides to check your cards: in this case, since you did bluff, you have to give 3 medal tokens to that player. That player ‘catches’ the killers you were trying to help escape and keeps them in his custody.

Custody: is when a player catches another player’s killers and keeps them face UP in front of them. This does not bode well for you, since, all the dirty cops are looking to help escape the most number of players. And when you get caught, it costs you more than just your pride

But: if you haven’t bluffed and a player checks your cards, then, they must give you 3 medal tokens for wrongful doubt, and those cards go face down in your Released Pile. Draw back to 7 cards in hand at the end of your turn. 

Securing Killers: Coming back to caught killers. These killers can be stolen by any of the players, so they must be secured. You can do so by placing up to 4 medal tokens on them. To steal a killer is harder now because the player will have to match the number of tokens on the killer to be able to steal it unless he has a Power Card that allows him to steal without having to give to give tokens. 

To release killers from your custody, you can do 1 of 2 things: 
Give 5 medal tokens and close the killer, or, use the Power Card that allows you to release the killer without having to give any tokens at all 

The Power Cards play an important role in the game too. Each Power Card has its description on the card itself. Please read through the cards to understand them better. But, with those in play, the game keeps changing until the very end. 

So, on your turn, you do one of the following:
Take 3 medal tokens (caps at 8. If you have 8 in hand you cannot take more)
Play character cards 
Play action cards 
Release killers 

The game ends when: 
When there are no playable cards in any player’s hands. 

Scoring:
The player to have the most number of killers in their released pile is the winner. 
But know this, any killers left in hand cancel out 1 killer from the closed pile. So make sure you let go of all the killer from your hand. 

If there’s a tie, then if any player has open killers in their custody wins

Name: Dirty Secret: Reveal your friends' most private and naughtiest secrets
Description:
With just a simple set of cards and coins, uncover your friends’ dirtiest experiences and socially unacceptable thoughts while maintaining complete anonymity. Drawing inspiration from Korea’s rampant drinking game culture, this raunchy board game will transform any stale party into an unforgettable night bursting with laughter. If your mind is constantly flooded with naughty thoughts, this is the game for you.

-- HOW TO PLAY --

1.Starting with the youngest player in the group, players take turns drawing 2 cards from the question card deck.
2.The player chooses which of the cards to ask the group and discards the unused question card.
3.Each player answers the question by putting “Yes” or “No” answer coin into the secret box in the middle of the table. Don’t let other players see your answer, this should be anonymous! 
4.After all players have placed a “Yes” or “No” coin into the secret box, the players choose a guessing card from their hand to match the number of “Yes” coins that they think the group has placed into the box. The player places their guessing card face down.
5.All players flip their guessing cards at the same time to show the group.
6.Open the secret box and count the number of “Yes” coins inside. Any player that chose the correct number guessing card gets one point and moves their Meeple to the next space on the score tracker. 
7.Repeat this process until someone reaches 5 points and becomes the winner.

Name: The Greatest Snake
Description:
Three to four players battle to consume questionable rodents and tape limbs to limbless reptiles in the name of serpentine supremacy!

The Greatest Snake shrugs off the idea of using numbers and counters to keep track of score. As the game progresses, you’ll see the whole battle physically unfold in front of you! Eaten rats become new body cards, empty body cards can be filled with equipment, and equipment can be covered by rats. So rev up your jetpack, tape on your crab claw, and get ready to become... The Greatest Snake!

Name: Bolt Action: Campaign – Market Garden
Description:
For Bolt Action players Market Garden has it all – daring attacks, determined resistance and heroic last stands by American, British, German and Polish troops ranging from elite veteran paratroopers to novices and from obsolete armoured cars to King Tiger tanks.

This volume covers a very short space of time compared to other Bolt Action campaign books – just a matter of nine days in September 1944 – and is focused on a much smaller geographical area; a single narrow route through the Netherlands rather than a broad sweep of very variable terrain across several countries.

—description from the publisher

Name: Pocket Pharma: R&D Mini Expansions
Description:
The expansion comprises 52 cards split into 5 exciting modules; mix and match the modules with the base game in any way you wish!

1. Advanced Drugs (4 cards) 
Four new Drug formulas to compete to create. For expert pharmacologists only!

2. Specialists (20 cards)
Each player gains a team of four expert scientists to help you boost the work of your lab and get ahead of your competitors in the race to develop new drugs.

3. Market Forces (8 cards) 
New opportunities to earn additional profits by achieving dominance in certain areas.

4. Experimental Fragments (8 cards)
Eight experimental “wildcard” fragments that cost an extra action to research but could plug the gaps in your formulae, possibly putting you ahead at the critical moment!

5. Biotech Startup (12 cards)
Adds a new core action to the game, that allows all players to earn additional end-game profits by collaboratively boosting a new biotech startup. Working secretly towards you own goals while competing to gain a majority in a new race for competitive advantage.

Name: Fix the World
Description:
Faced with overwhelming global issues the governments of the world are appealing to the general public for out-of-the-box solutions that can save us all.

Do you have super-high intelligence and an absurdly creative mind? No? It doesn't matter, it's still up to you to save the world. In this fun and fast-paced game players try to come up with out-of-the-box solutions to global issues and convince the government investors to invest in their ideas.

And who knows, you might even come up with a really good idea that actually solves a problem. It's worth shot!

—description from the publisher

Name: The Dresden Files Cooperative Card Game: Expansion 5 – Winter Schemes
Description:
Feeling Winter’s bite?

Warm up with this expansion for the Dresden Files Cooperative Card Game! Inside you’ll find two alternative character decks—Winter Knight Harry and Winter Lady Molly—and two new book decks—Cold Days and Skin Game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Kamikaze Chess
Description:
Kamikaze Chess is a small, portable set of 64 tiles that can be used to play traditional chess, checkers or a custom variant of chess.  32 of the tiles become the black squares of the chessboard, with the gaps between tiles acting as the white squares.  The other 32 tiles have chess pieces printed on one side and checkers printed on the other.

The namesake custom variant Kamikaze Chess introduces two changes, custom placement of pieces and action spaces:

After setting up the checkerboard, players shuffle their tiles keeping the chess symbol face down (showing the checkers side), then take turns placing their pieces on the white squares (gaps) until the board is full.  Then players flip over all of the chess pieces to reveal the layout and play chess with the usual rules from that position.  It is additionally suggested that one bishop on each side is moved to an adjacent black square at this point.

When players move a piece onto any black square, they flip over the tile and perform the action listed on that other side, which may be helpful or harmful.  Players leave the space with the action side up and do not reactivate the actions.

Name: Lebensraum: The War For Europe, 1941-1945
Description:
"Lebensraum: The War For Europe, 1941-1945" is a grand strategic, moderate complexity wargame of the war between Nazi Germany and the Allied Nations, starting with the German invasion of the USSR in late June of 1941, through to the final battles to Berlin in 1945. The game includes both East and West Fronts, and can be played in a number of small (3 to 13) turn historical scenarios starting with Barbarossa in the East and Italy in the West, or in campaigns for each front individually, or a combined East and West front campaign.

The game focuses on the Army group level, with players controlling subordinate armies as their main combat formations. Leadership is a major component of the game, with each player having a pool of named and rated leaders available. Airpower, naval support, partisans, production centers, and transportation networks are all featured. Turns are quarterly, with a map scale of 50 miles (80km) per hex.

This game is a new edition of the Simulations Canada wargames Lebensraum and West Front. The two wargames have been updated to include all known errata, some small additions, and have been combined into one game, but can be played as separate scenarios. With fresh new artwork this large, strategic level game now has lew life breathed into it.

—description from the publisher
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Alien Entity: Mutated
Description:
In Alien Entity: Mutated, you play as a group of astronauts trying to escape a sabotaged medical ship. An unknown member of the team has been mutated by an alien entity and will sabotage and mutate the researchers as they try and repair the satellite array to contact mission control. Will you survive? Are your friends mutated by an alien entity? Can you contact mission control before it’s too late? Grab some friends and join the paranoia!

Alien Entity is meant to be played multiple times. Players are passed cards face down to determine who is playing as a human or an alien. The humans win if the satellite array is built, they escape on the escape pod or the alien gets shot. The alien wins if it passes out mutation cards to all of the humans. After each game ends players may be eligible to open up legacy style expansion packs depending on the outcome of each game.

Each player draws cards from a central pile and takes turns playing and passing cards. Choose wisely because you will only be able to play one action and one battery card per turn. You may pass cards face down to other players to either help them or hurt their progress. If you are a human you may want to pass parts of the satellite array to another human. If you are an alien you can pass mutation cards to other players to get them on your side.

Games usually last between ten to twenty minutes. Once certain requirements are met new card packs are opened and introduced into the game altering the game play. The new cards give players alternate weapons and equipment to make every play through unique.

—description from the publisher

Name: Alhambra: Mega Box
Description:
Like the building it is named after, Alhambra, the international award winning game from Dirk Henn, has become a landmark in the board game world, having been translated into more than 25 languages, and winning countless awards, including the coveted "Spiel des Jahres" in 2003. In its 15 years of existence The Alhambra family has grown significantly; six expansions, totaling 24 modules, and several stand alone games have been released.

Along with the base game, Alhambra: Mega Box features:


     All new artwork for the base game and all expansions

     Larger tiles

     New box artwork and 2 tile dispenser towers



     Eleven new expansion modules from famous designers:
         Mike Elliott - The Towers of Power
         Michael Schacht - The Alhambra Zoo
         Klaus Jürgen Wrede - Travelling Craftsmen & The Wishing Well
         Rüdiger Dorn - The Extensions
         Dirk Henn - The New Building Ground
         Emanuele Ornella - The Palace Staff
         Stefan Feld - The Handymen
         Michael Rieneck - Gates Without End
         Ruskowski & Süßelbeck - Fresh Color & The Palace Planner
    



     Three fan-submitted expansion modules:
         Louis-David Péloquin - The Personal Building Markets 
         Frank Sander - The Treasures
         Stefan Schlitz - The Caliph's Guidelines
    



     Three additional new expansions from famous designers from a second Kickstarter run:
         Dirk Henn - The Double Tiles
         Emanuele Ornella - The Orchard
         Klaus Jürgen Wrede - The Bathhouses
    



     The following previously released expansions:
         Expansion 1: The Vizier's Favour
         Expansion 2: The City Gates
         Expansion 3: The Thief's Turn
         Expansion 4: The Treasure Chamber
         Expansion 5: Power of the Sultan
         Expansion 6: The Falconers
         Queenie 1: The Magical Building
         Queenie 2: The Medina
Families: Versions & Editions: Big Box Versions of Individual Games

Name: HAGGIS: The Fantasy Golf Miniatures Game
Description:
For hundreds of years, brave heroes have kept the peace in the kingdom of Somland.
Delving deep into ancient tombs, driving dragons from the countryside, and vanquishing vile foes of unearthly natures.

But even heroes take weekends off.

Thus was created that most illustrious of games, golf. Regulated by the Honorable and Ancient Golf Guild Illustrious of Somland (HAGGIS).

This book contains all the rules you will need to create your hero, select your equipment and then hit the links for a rousing round of golf. Heroes can even gain treasure and experience - if they survive.

The greens of Somland hold great riches for those willing to compete for them. Just beware the dragon sleeping at the 18th hole.

HAGGIS is a casual "beer and pretzels" style miniatures game about playing golf in a high fantasy world. Players will: create heroes, hire caddies with various special abilities, acquire equipment and magical upgrades. All in an effort to best other players and avoid monsters and hazards on a tabletop fantasy golf course of your design!

Features:

Fun and unique game premise
    Low cost
    Easy to learn
    Requires few miniatures
    Suitable for solo or group play
    Includes campaign rules for character advancement

—description from the publisher

Name: BABYDINO
Description:
BABYDINO is a family board game in which each player will start from a dino egg that must transform into a new born baby dino. The winner of the game will be the fastest one.

The game is composed of a multitude of die-cut pieces, a deck of 20 prehistoric cards and personalized dice. The mechanisms of the game are mainly dice management, which will help you first to break the shell of your egg, and then to place the dinosaur pieces in their corresponding place. But the task will not be simple because one of the dice is destined to avoid that the rivals get their complete dinosaur.

•••

BABYDINO es un juego de mesa familiar, donde cada jugador partirá de un huevo de dinosaurio que deberá transformar en un bebe de dinosario recién nacido. El ganador del juego será quien más rápido lo consiga.
El juego está compuesto por multitud de piezas troqueladas, una baraja de 20 cartas de prehistoria y dados personalizados.
La mecánica de juego es principalmente de gestión de dados, los cuales te ayudarán primero a romper el cascarón de tu huevo, y posteriormente a colocar los trozos de dinosaurio en su sitio correspondiente. Pero la tarea no será sencilla pues uno de los dados está destinado a evitar a que los rivales consigan su dinosaurio completo.

Name: Goblin Mountain
Description:
"Your group of adventurers barely entered the labyrinthine tunnels of Goblin Mountain when the inevitable happens: you get lost and the goblins get wind of your presence. Time to find a way out fast and, of course, fill your pockets with every gem and coin you can get your hands on on the way. And don't forget to stick together! Because bad things happen when you split up the group... always!"

Goblin Mountain is a competitive dice-placement game, where 2 players take turns to move their adventurers (dice) through a linear dungeon and maximize treasure and fame while trying to make it to the exit without getting caught by the goblins.

—description from the designer

As part of the 2018 9-Card Nanogame Contest, Goblin Mountain won:

1st place - Best Artwork (34 competitors)
2nd place - Best Overall Game (70 competitors)
2nd place - Best Two Player Game (48 competitors)
2nd place - Best New Designer (33 competitors)
2nd place - Best Written Rules (47 competitors)
3rd place - Best Solitaire Game (25 competitors)
9th place - Most Innovative Mechanic (36 competitors)

Components
9 cards
8 six-sided dice (2 orange, 2 yellow, 2 black, 2 blue)
9 cubes (2 orange, 2 yellow, 2 green, 3 blue)
1 pawn (solo mode only)

Name: Bolt Action: Campaign – The Road to Berlin
Description:
As the Allies advance towards Germany, they face dogged resistance from the hard-pressed German forces. Take command of the Allies in their final push to end the war in Europe, or hold fast as the German defenders as the fight is brought to your door. This new Campaign Book for Bolt Action offers new linked scenarios, rules, troop types and Theatre Selectors, and provides plenty of options for novice and veteran players alike.

Campaign Overview

Operation Bargration
- Fighting Bargration - Which includes scenarios, special rules and historical context
 - Bargration Theatre Selectors - Which includes famous platoons such as the 53rd Guards tank Brigade, German Heavy Tank Abteilung and the 5th Panzer Division!
- Additional German Units:
-- Scenario 1: The Tigers of Krupki
-- Scenario 2: The battle of Pleshchenitsy
-- Scenario 3: The '34'

Lvov-Sandomierz Offensive
- Fighting the Lvov-Sandomierz offensive - Which includes scenarios, special rules and Lvov-Sandomierz specific scenarios
- Lvov-Sandomierz theatre selectors
- Scenario 4: big game hunting - Which includes a hero of the Soviet Union, Lt. Aleksandr P. Oskin

The Warsaw Uprising
- Fighting the Warsaw uprising - Which includes scenarios, special rules and Warsaw uprising specific scenarios
- Warsaw uprising theatre selectors
- Armia krajowa theatre selector - Which includes additional Armia Krajowa Units and German Warsaw Uprising Units
- Scenario 5: Man the barricades
- Scenario 6: Kubus and the grey wolf

The Struggle Continues
- Fighting ‘the struggle continues’ - Which includes scenarios, special rules for ghost wars and the Struggle Continues Theatre Selectors
- NKVD Theatre Selector
- NKVD Additional Units

Clearing The Flanks
- Scenario 7: Breakout from Petsamo

The Vistula-Oder Offensive
- Fighting the Vistula-Oder offensive - Which includes General Scenarios and Vistula-Oder Scenarios
- Vistula-Oder offensive theatre selectors
- Scenario 8: ‘the Ivan’s are coming…’
- Scenario 9: race to the Pileca river
- Scenario 10: an unexpected encounter

Operation Berlin
- Fighting Operation Berlin
- Scenarios - Which include General Scenarios and special rules for Operation Berlin Scenarios
- Operation Berlin theatre selectors - Which include the extended Last Levy Theatre Selector and the replacement Panzer Force
- Additional German Units - Which include The German Replacement Army and a hero of the Soviet Union, junior Sergeant Vasily Kharinaevich Khantaev
- Scenario 11: The Seelow heights
- Scenario 12: Tank hunting
- Scenario 13: Berlin: crossing the spree

The Prague Uprising
- Fighting the Prague uprising - Which includes scenarios, general scenarios, Prague specific scenarios and The ROA
- ROA theatre selector
- Additional Units
- Scenario 14: The Prague uprising: enter the ROA

Appendices: Additional Special Rules
- Snow, mud, ice and frostbite
- Dug-in: foxholes, trenches and gun pits
- Minefields
- City fighting

Name: Glyph: Tinker Champion
Description:
Glyph is a dice-building combat strategy game for 2-6 players. Players are tasked with forming a team of three champions and defeat their opponent. These Champions are broken up into three distinct classes--Strikers, Guardians, and Adherents--with each Champion having his or her own strengths, weaknesses, and unique abilities which you will use by harnessing the power of mystical glyphs. As the game progresses, your Champions will have the opportunity to acquire new items which will enhance their capabilities as well as perhaps give them even more skills to use to defeat your enemy.

Glyph: The Tinker further expands the options available to players for customizing their group of Champions with a the Tinker, a hero with the ability to create his own unique items for battle, and even pawn them off when the tribe needs some extra gold.

—user summary

Name: Devil's Run: Route 666 – Reaper's Revenge
Description:
Devil's Run: Reapers Revenge is a fast-moving and hard-hitting vehicular combat board game (for 2-6 players) set in a post-apocalyptic America.

This is a standalone expansion to Devil's Run: Route 666 and each can be played on their own or can be mashed together for more extreme carnage!

The Devil's Run system uses a rolling board mechanic, to ensure all players feel like they are on the edge of their seat; fall too far behind and you are out of the race, get too far in front and you could open yourself to an airstrike or an unexpected obstacle in the road. Live fast and die hard on Hell's Highway. Can you survive the Devil's Run?

There are four main types of vehicles: Bikes, Trikes, Buggies and Cars. Each of these vehicle types play differently due to how they drive, their weapons and their arcs of fire. The game has story driven missions which are a mix of full throttle racing and maximum carnage vehicular battle, with an immersive ruleset to make you feel like you're a part of the post-apoc action. You use three, six and ten sided dice, statlines and modifications to represent every aspect of the game from scenery effects, shooting, ramming and sideswiping, to using equipment like Nitros, Oil Slicks and Smoke Screens.
A battle between the Hunters and the Questing Knights...who will win...who will even survive?

—description from the publisher

Name: Saga: Age of Crusades
Description:
Deus vult!
At the dawn of the thirteenth century, these words set Europe aflame.
The hearts of nobles and serfs alike are filled with an ardent desire to absolve their sins by taking up arms against the enemies of the faith.
In 1095, the princes of the west answer the Pope's call, take the cross, and travel to Jerusalem to liberate the Holy City from the hands of the infidels.
In 1147, the same call goes out again, and turns the might of Christendom against the Baltic shores where Europe's last pagans thrive.
On the Iberian peninsula, Spanish lords resume their attempts to reconquer the lands the Moors have ruled since 711.
For more than two centuries, these unprecedented military expeditions will see kingdoms and cultures rise and fall. Great champions will lead their nations through heroic battles whose consiquences will be felt for decades.

SAGA Age of Crusades is a SAGA Supplement which covers the wars of faith fought in the West  and the East from the First Crusade to the Mongol invasions. 
This Universe offers 12 factions covering every arena of battle, each one with its own Battle Board, legendary unit, heroes and special rules.
The book also contains auxiliary units to recruit, and a variant on the standard game which transforms your game into a battle of faith!

Follow in the wake of Godfrey of Bouillon, join the ranks of the Teutonic Order, fight alongside Saladin or resist with the Baltic tribes. Do not weaken for the valian will survive and win eternity in heaven!

NOTE - You will need a copy of SRB20 SAGA Rulebook to use SAGA Age of Crusades!

Name: Saga: Age of Vikings
Description:
793...The peaceful monastery of Lindisfarne is attacked and pillaged by men who rise out of the mists, cleaving the waves in ppowerful ships.

This attack marks the beginning of the story of the Vikings, also known as the Northmen, Sea Wolves and Scourge of the Faithful. For the next three centuries, every coast and every city will live in fear of these warriors and their unequalled savagery.

Soon, the Norsemen will no longer be satisfied with looting, theft and pillaging. the armies of the powerful Scandinavian kingdoms will come together in fleets to descend upon Europe, conquering countries, ransoming kings and emperors and founding colonies.

Age of Vikings is a SAGA supplement covering Europe from the emergence of the Norse kingdoms to the Battle of Hastings which marked the end of the era.

This Universe offers you 12 factions covering all four corners of Europe during this period, each with its own Battle Board, history, legendary units and special rules.

This book also contains rules for mercenary units which can be recruited by your warbands and an appendix on Relics & Artifacts from this heroic age.

Relive the exploits of heroes liek Harald Hardrada, William the Conqueror or Charlemagne! The greatest sagas were written by the Viking poets - can you surpass them?

This book comes with 12 Battle Boards which may not be sold separately.

Factions covered are: The Anglo-Saxons...The Welsh (inc Strathclyde)..,,,The Normans (inc the Bretons)...The Vikings...The Anglo-Danes....The Last Romans..(Byzantines!) The Norse-Gaels..... The Irish....The Pagan Rus......The Scots.....The Carolingians....The Jomsvikings...

PLEASE NOTE - You will need a copy of SRB20 SAGA The Rulebook to use this supplement.

Name: Tinderbox Tales
Description:
Tinderbox Tales expands on the setting for The Brigade, with this three-game set being presented like a boxed set of books. The games included are:

• The Barmaid's Tale

Set in the "Rat Catcher's Rest", this is a social game for 4-6 players. Players assign blame to each other for the failure of a recent quest while literally "passing the buck".

• The Trader's Tale

Play out the events of one of the most famous days in the history of the merchant's district. "Ruby Twosday" saw every adventurer in Tinderbox racing to equip themselves for the quest to rescue the Princess making a lot of traders very rich in the process. This resource management game challenges 2-4 adventuring agents to trade carefully to be the first to build and outfit their team for the quest.

• The Damsel's Tale 

Damsel etiquette will tell you that you can never really trust a knight to save you properly, but as long as your dragon needs feeding, you should let them have a go. In this two-player asymmetrical strategy game of hide and sneak, the dragon is trying to alert his mother to the presence of a cunning knight sent to steal from the horde.

Tinderbox Tales is the second release from Red Genie Games set in "The Vague World".

Name: Cerberus Deck-Building Game: Cryptozoic 2017 Volunteer Promo Card
Description:
A normal card to add to any Cerberus game. These cards were printed in extremely limited supply and given to the volunteers that helped demo Cryptozoic's games during the 2017 season of conventions.

Dungstar the Poo Pope
Villain

+  2 power

You may discard a card from your hand and say, "Total crap!" If you do, look at the top X cards of your deck, where X is the cost of the card you discarded. Put one of them on top of your deck. Discard the rest.

Name: Gold Rush
Description:
Gold Rush is a game for 2 to 6 players.  The action takes place in the town of Dry Gulch, adjacent to some newly discovered gold fields. The players compete in all the excitement of staking and recording claims, mining and shipping gold, As well as the gun battles, fist fights, and  hijackings Associated with this colorful period of the American Frontier. The player with the most gold bars at the end of the game is the winner of Gold Rush. (description as stated at the beginning of the instruction sheet)

Gold Rush is a vintage roll and move style game. Players take turns acquiring deeds to mines on which they will insert assay and mining equipment cards. They then return to the gold fields to collect gold bars, and then back to town again to their hotel rooms. If they encounter another player along their route, the will duel, with the possibility of losing their own gold or stealing their opponents gold.

—user summary

Name: Singularity Deck
Description:
The Singularity Deck is an evolution of playing cards that is community expandable allowing for an immense number of games to be played. Each suit in the deck includes all standard ranks, A-K, plus a few extras including an 11-12, a singularity card ranked 0 and infinity, a city card, and an omega card. The omega cards each representing some major catastrophe that could befall the earth. Each suit begins with alpha and ends in omega (excluding the singularity itself). The cards have secondary suits called shields, and secondary dice ranks. The suits and card back designs are part of the public domain allowing anyone to expand or add to the deck.

The full deck consists of 3 standalone sets:
The earth set: consisting of 6 suits.
The cosmos set: consisting of an additional 6 suits.
The spacetime set: consisting of a single suit ranked from 0-100.

Name: コロウラ (Koroura)
Description:
Play takes place on a 5 x 5 grid and each player has three robot koroura and three dice. 
At the beginning of the game each player rolls their three dice and places them in their koroura. The one with the highest initial value becomes the boss. In order to keep track, the die of the opponents color is exchanged. Players then take turns rolling one of their three dice which are placed in the koroura to determine movement options for that turn. The game ends when the opponents boss koroura is “taken”.

—user summary

Name: Keeper of the Zoo
Description:
Go on safari with a challenging and fun game of chance using one die and animal cards. The object of the game is to go on Safari and brig 4 animals from their start location (origin) to your finish location (zoo) and have the 4 corresponding animal cards placed in front of you and do so before your opponents.

—description from the box

Name: Where's Baby Jesus?
Description:
Where's Baby Jesus? is a simple children's game where players spin the spinner and move the indicated number of spaces. When they land on a space that shows a picture with a missing object, they can then immediately move to the space that shows that missing object. The first player to reach the final space on the board wins the game.

As described on the back of the board, this game is supposed to stimulate conversation with children about the birth of Jesus, as depicted in Luke 2 and Matthew 2.

—user summmary

Name: Terrigeo Perú
Description:
Terrigeo is a filler game of observation and reflexes about peruvian geography (peruvian regions)
You could learn how to play it in a minute. Is not necessary  previous knowledge.

The goal is to accumulate as many regions as you can!

Game dynamics: Deal 1 map and 3 cards to each player; In turn the challenges will be revealed, and whoever is the first to guess the challenge with the cards in hand, saying the name of the region aloud, takes that letter; the game ends, when the deck of Regions has been used up.

Name: Gangs of Rome: Blood on the Aventine
Description:
Senator Caius Norbanus Flaccus has not only commissioned a temple to the god Apollo, but he has also provided a beautiful—not to mention expensive—statue of the god to watch over the temple’s construction.

Two rivals for Flaccus’ position on the Senate have both dispatched small gangs of fighters to sack the temple and steal the statue, the disappearance of which will cause embarrassment to the Senator.

However, Flaccus is not quite as naïve as these Domini would believe, and he has invested in a little insurance for his temple and the statue therein: the imposing—and obstinate—Gaul, Talavus...

This scenario box set for Gangs of Rome – Blood on the Aventine contains everything you need to play this innovative tabletop skirmish game.  This starter scenario box set for GoR contains the following:

Gangs of Rome A4 Full Rulebook
    Blood on the Aventine Scenario
    6 x Single piece fighters
    6 x Named fighter cards
    16 x Equipment/Skill Coins and cards featuring four unique coins for this scenario
    1 Gaul watchman, Incola card and base
    1 x Personal Influence Marker card
    6 x Activation pebbles (3 x 2 different colours)
    7 Roman numeral dice
    2 x MDF Movement rulers
    6 x Jigsaw Base
    6 x Sets of flesh tokens
    2 x sets of ID markers ( 1 - 3, two colours)
    MDF Temple under construction scenery by Sarissa Precision
    1 x Objective token

Packed with all these Gangs of Rome essentials and exclusive content, Blood on the Aventine is the perfect way to begin or expand your collection. So take your fate in your hands, Dominus, and recruit, dominate and ascend.

Name: Rorshöck!
Description:
What do you see when you stare at a Jackson Pollock? A drippy gooey mess or an angst ridden family dinner? Or how about when you gaze up at the clouds? Do you see a herd of African elephants or a bunch of cotton balls? Every day we are exposed to images that prompt or provoke our psyches. And what we see says a lot about our personalities--or lack thereof. That's why the simple act of seeing images in an ink blot can be so revealing--especially with the assistance of a highly paid, over-educated psychotherapist. But not everyone has that kind of time... or money. Which is exactly why Rorshock! cards are so indispensable.

Game includes 20 ink blot cards and a "Diagnosis Book" and offers multiple ways to play. Play can be as straightforward as one player saying what they see in an inkblot and another player diagnosing it with the closest matching diagnosis for that card in the book. Alternatively, the ink blots can be used to inspire  writing prompts or games of Charades.

Name: Le jeu des familles Gargouille en bandes dessinées
Description:
This card game is based on the popular Quebec French-language comic "Gargouille."

The goal of the game is to collect the largest number of families (each family is composed of four cards).

All 32 cards are shuffled and distributed as evenly as possible between all players.

The first player picks a card in his hand, and asks any opponent if they have a card in the same family. When requesting a card from an opponent, players must specify both the family name and the number of the card. For example, a player might request the third card from the éclairs family (the éclairs with three symbols on it). If the opponent has that card, they must give it to the player.

As long as the player gets the cards they asks for, they can continue. For each new card, they request a card from the opponent of their choice.

However, if the player does not get the requested card, their turn is over.

The opponent who did not have the requested card becomes the new active player. Play continues until all families have been assembled.

For a two player game:
Distribute 10 cards to each player. The remaining cards constitute a stack on the table. If your opponent does not have the card you want, you draw a card from the stack.

Name: FootballFans: Welcome to Russia
Description:
Hilarious board game and real World Cup simulator for true football lovers, their friends, family members and anyone, who wants to feel the thrill of the fight !
This Game will tell you about the adventures of football fans in Russia. Funny caricatures, lots of humor, fighting spirit of football fans and excitement of a great sporting are waiting for you in this Game!
Travel around Russian cities, rent airports, stadiums, hotels, bars and gyms, play football matches. Win a World Cup!

This Game is a Football World Cup tournament simulator. As in real football, your success depends not only on the skills of your players but also on your managing, financial abilities and on how lucky you are. The World Cup 2018 is held in Russia, so all game events take place in Russian cities.

First, you choose your teams: there are 32 national football teams in the game; each team possesses its own unique skill and level of such features as: Team Power, Fans Power, Mood, Luck.
Then you decide what real property would you like to rent before the game starts.
Initially, each player has 200 football rubles. A player can rent an Airport, a Hotel, a Stadium, a Bar or a Gym on this money. All these objects may bring money to their owners as well as increase their team’s chances on winning matches. The prices of the property may vary, depending on the city. The game will start as soon as all players decide they have purchased enough.  
Further on, purchases can be made after EACH round, in EACH group and after EACH play-off match.

The tournament schedule is the same as in real football:

32 teams distribute in 8 groups and play 3 tours each vs each in the group.
In group matches: victory – 3 points, tie – 1 point, defeat – 0 points. 
Two teams scored the highest number of points qualify
The next step is the play-off tournament for those 16 teams who qualified. There cannot be ties on this stage. If a game is tied at the end of regulation time, penalty shootouts are used to decide the winner.
At the end there are only two teams left, who play the final match. The winner gets the World Cup.

Matches are played according to team’s features: Team Power, Fans Power, Mood, Luck. Each of the four features is compared. If a team has a higher level of a particular feature – this team scores a goal. If the level is the same, nobody scores. During the game players will have many chances to increase levels of these features, and they should use them wisely.

—description from the publisher

Name: Sakenobori
Description:
In Sakenobori / ã•ã‘ã®ã¼ã‚Š (which means "salmon run"), players want to move their salmon upstream as far as possible to lay eggs (ikura, or salmon roe).

Each of the three rounds plays out the same way. Players each have a hand of five river cards and one bear card. At the start of the round, players take turns laying down cards face down one at a time in a pyramid shape until each player has placed three cards. Then players take turns placing their salmon on a card in the first row.

Players then take turns in an action phase in which they optionally swim their salmon to a new location, jumping occupied spaces and revealing the card where they land, if it were hidden. Land on a bear and you're out for the round unless you can counter with a bear from your hand. After moving, you can either place a card from your hand face down to add to the river or pass. Once all players pass in turn, the round ends and players then collect ikura tokens equal to their rank in the pyramid.

In the third round, players score an ikura bonus depending on their final rank, then whoever has collected (a.k.a. spawned) the most ikura wins!
